description: Add support for displaying dismissible announcement banners on the homepage (under the title bar). Store dismissed announcement state in cookies so users don't see the same announcement repeatedly after dismissing it.
design:
Implementation should include:
- Data structure/content collection for announcements (with ID, message, type/priority, date range)
- Banner component that displays under the navigation bar
- Dismiss button functionality
- Cookie-based persistence to track dismissed announcements
- Support for multiple active announcements (show highest priority first)
- Styling that matches site design (possibly using Tailwind alert classes)
acceptance_criteria:
- Announcements can be defined in content collection or config
- Banner displays on homepage under navigation
- Users can dismiss banners with X button
- Dismissed state persists via cookies across sessions
- Previously dismissed announcements don't reappear
- Multiple announcements show in priority order
- Responsive design works on mobile and desktop

title: Create GitHub OAuth application
description:
Create OAuth app in GitHub Settings → Developer settings → OAuth Apps:
- Application name: MDGC Website CMS
- Homepage URL: https://mdgc.netlify.app (update when domain finalized)
- Authorization callback URL: https://mdgc.netlify.app/api/callback
- Save Client ID and Client Secret for next step
notes: This requires manual action via GitHub web interface. User needs to: 1) Go to GitHub Settings → Developer settings → OAuth Apps, 2) Create new OAuth app with: name='MDGC Website CMS', homepage='https://mdgc.pages.dev', callback='https://mdgc.pages.dev/api/callback', 3) Save Client ID and Client Secret for mdgc-18

title: Add GitHub OAuth secrets to Cloudflare Pages
description:
In Cloudflare Pages project settings, add environment variables:
- GITHUB_CLIENT_ID (from OAuth app)
- GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET (from OAuth app)
- Mark as encrypted/secret
- Deploy to both production and preview environments
notes: After mdgc-17 is complete, add these environment variables in Cloudflare Pages project settings (Settings → Environment variables): GITHUB_CLIENT_ID and GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET. Make sure to add them for both Production and Preview environments.

title: Add OAuth functions for Cloudflare Pages
description:
Create functions/ directory at project root with OAuth handlers:
- functions/api/auth.js - initiates OAuth flow
- functions/api/callback.js - handles OAuth callback
- Source: https://github.com/i40west/netlify-cms-cloudflare-pages
- These auto-deploy with Cloudflare Pages

description:
Modify public/admin/config.yml:
- Change backend.name from 'git-gateway' to 'github'
- Add backend.repo: 'mdub/mdgc'
- Add backend.base_url: site URL
- Add backend.auth_endpoint: 'api/auth'

title: Test Decap CMS GitHub authentication
description:
Verify complete OAuth flow:
- Visit /admin on deployed site
- Click login button
- Authenticate with GitHub
- Verify CMS loads and can access content
- Test creating/editing content via CMS
- Confirm commits appear in GitHub repo
notes: After mdgc-17, mdgc-18, mdgc-19, and mdgc-20 are all complete and the site is deployed, test the OAuth flow: 1) Visit https://mdgc.pages.dev/admin, 2) Click 'Login with GitHub', 3) Authorize the app, 4) Verify you can see and edit content, 5) Make a test change and verify it creates a commit

Set up GitHub backend for Decap CMS
description:
Configure Decap CMS to use GitHub backend with OAuth authentication for Cloudflare Pages deployment.

## Authentication Flow
- GitHub OAuth app handles user authentication
- Cloudflare Pages Functions provide OAuth endpoints (/api/auth and /api/callback)
- Users authenticate with their GitHub accounts (must have push access to repo)

## Key Resources
- Functions code: https://github.com/i40west/netlify-cms-cloudflare-pages or https://github.com/SubhenduX/decap-cms-cloudflare-pages
- Guide: https://www.abhishek-tiwari.com/deploying-hugo-sites-on-cloudflare-pages-with-decap-cms-and-github-backend/
- Decap docs: https://decapcms.org/docs/github-backend/
